SENT.plain: Angelman syndrome is a rare genetic disorder scarcely diagnosed before the age of two years
We report the case of an eight-month-old female presenting with severe hypotonia, myoclonus, suspected spasms and an electroencephalogram with hypsarrhythmic-like features
She was initially treated with vigabatrin which resulted in worsening of myoclonic jerks
Fluorometric in situ hybridization revealed a chromosomal deletion at region 15q11-13
We discuss the case and differential diagnosis with other conditions including West syndrome
